upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 1. Bhû, Bhuvas, Suvas 4 , these are the three sacred interjections (vyâh ri ti). Mâhâ k amasya taught a fourth, viz. Mahas, which is Brahman, which is the Self. The others (devatâs) are its members.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: Bhû is this world, Bhuvas is the sky, Suvas is the other world.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 2. Mahas is the sun. All the worlds are increased by the sun. Bhû is Agni (fire), Bhuvas is Vâyu (air), Suvas is Âditya (sun). Mahas is the moon. All the heavenly lights are increased by the moon.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: Bhû is the Ri k -verses, Bhuvas is the Sâman-verses, Suvas is the Ya g us-verses.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: 3. Mahas is Brahman. All the Vedas are increased by the Brahman.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: (1-2) Bhû is Prâ n a (up-breathing), Bhuvas is Apâna, (down-breathing), Suvas is Vyâna (back-breathing). Mahas is food. All breathings are increased by food.

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: Thus there are these four times four, the four and four sacred interjections. He who knows these,

upanishad: The Upanishads, Part 2 (SBE15): Taittirîyaka-Upanis... | Sacred Texts Archive
translator: Max Müller (Sacred Books of the East) — Public Domain
text: (1-2) Knows the Brahman. All Devas bring offerings to him.
